description: Sequence of 3 Pythagorean triangles, each with a leg and hypotenuse prime. The hypotenuse of each triangle is the leg of the next triangle.
links: H. Dubner and T. Forbes, Prime Pythagorean triangles, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.3.
formula: For each p(n), q=(p*p+1)/2, r=(q*q+1)/2, s=(r*r+1)/2 and p, q, r, s are all prime.
author: Harvey Dubner (harvey(AT)dubner.com)
